storage
Class ContentClient

java.lang.Object
  storage.ContentClient

public class ContentClient
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates sending messages and receiving responses from the distributed content storage DHT

Version:
20130411
Author:
Michael Collis (mcollis@seas.upenn.edu)

Constructor Detail

ContentClient

public ContentClient(java.net.InetAddress gateway)
Default constructor

Parameters:
gateway - InetAddress of bootstrap node of content storage DHT
Method Detail

sendGet

public UrlContent sendGet(java.lang.String docHash)
Send a GET request to the storage system

Parameters:
docHash - SHA-256 hash of the document content to be retrieved
Returns:
UrlContent object with the primary key requested if it exists in the database; else, returns null if object with requested key does not exist or if there was an error transmitting the message

sendPut

public boolean sendPut(UrlContent toPut)
Send a PUT request to the storage system

Parameters:
toPut - UrlContent object to be stored in the database
Returns:
True if the object was sent correctly; else, returns False if there was a port or connection error (True return statement makes no guarantee about the consistency of the storage system after the message was successfully transmitted)

sendContains

public boolean sendContains(java.lang.String docHash)
Send a CONTAINS request to the storage system

Parameters:
docHash - SHA-256 hash of the document to check if it currently exists in the database
Returns:
True if the message was sent correctly and the storage system was able to locate the requested document; else, returns False
